page.title: 10 Redenham.
page.content:
{Redenham}village is situated in this square, an attractive{village consisting mainly of brick and flint {cottages,}several beautiful old thatched{houses}and other less ancient houses.
Most have their own large gardens, often beautifully cared for, providing flowers and vegetables for their owners. There is an attractive{public {house}called the 'Dog and Gun'.
The area is criss-crossed by many small{roads}and tracks. A derelict {school}is situated at one junction, symbol of the decline in stable population and the general movement of younger people to towns for employment and the difficulty of maintaining {schools}with a small number on roll by local rates.
